sequence:
Sirius' Improvement Plan

<size=45>Chapter 7 - Like The Brightest Star</size>

scripts.say: The fight was over in a matter of minutes.
As soon as the Sirens had made their appearance, they were promptly turned into little more than wrecks.
What rubbish! They stole the limelight from my Home Fleet!
There is no need to mobilise the Home Fleet to fight mere planes, Your Majesty... At any rate, this was a victory for the Royal Navy, so wouldn't you agree this is a splendid outcome?
...I must admit, the anti-air capabilities of the Dido-class are a marvel to behold.
Or perhaps this fine display of skill was only possible thanks to your swift decision back there, Commander?
That decision I made in the banquet hall came from my trust in Sirius and the knowledge that if anyone could do it, it would be her.
And that decision turned out to be right. That's all there's to it.
And so, Sirius, donning her white rose dress, made her triumphant return.
My honourable Master, I have cleared the path so that you may move forward.
Silently and elegantly, she reached her hand out to me.
No matter the attire I may wear, I will always be your maid, doing everything in her power to fulfil your wishes.
Were it your wish, I would more brightly and magnificently than anyone else.
Whether on the dance floor of a banquet or in the clouds of smoke on the battlefield, please allow this humble servant of yours to be your partner now and forever.
Like a polished diamond resting in the snow, she was gleaming, and so utterly beautiful.
